description: Disassociates GuardDuty member accounts (from the current administrator account) specified by the account IDs.
mitreAttackSubTechniques: T1562.001 - Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By disassociating member accounts, an adversary could remove access to GuardDuty for specific accounts, reducing the ability to detect and respond to malicious activities.
Disassociating member accounts might effectively stop the GuardDuty service from monitoring those accounts, similar to stopping a security service to avoid detection.

researchLinks.description: Threat Hunting with CloudTrail and GuardDuty in Splunk

securityImplications: Attackers might use DisassociateMembers to remove members from a GuardDuty detector, disrupting threat detection and security analysis.
